text: In a Saudi Arabian patient with 3MC syndrome-2 (265050), Rooryck et al. (2011) identified homozygosity for a 3-bp in-frame deletion (648CTC) in exon 8 of the COLEC11 gene, resulting in the deletion of a highly conserved serine residue (ser217del) in the carbohydrate recognition domain. The mutated alleles segregated with the disorder in the family, and the mutation was not found in 192 Saudi control chromosomes.
